text: ECON4570 : Problem Set 3 Due by 11:59pm on Nov 03, 20241 1. Low birth weight infants tend to have increased risks of serious health problems. It has been suggested that factors related to birth weight in- clude baby sex, gestational age at which the child is born, race, mother height and mother weight. To investigate this relationship, 500 infants born in a large metropolitan hospital in the U.S. were studied and the following model was estimated: Bwi = β1 + β2Sexi + β3GAi + β4Blacki + β5M Hi + β6M Wi + ϵi where Bw = Infant birth weight Sex = 1 if male, 0 otherwise Black = 1 if mother is black, 0 otherwise GA = Gestational age (calculated as number of weeks/40) M H = Mother height (calculated as actual height (in feet)/5.8) M W = Mother weight (calculated as actual weight (in pound) /130) For a range of models the coefficient estimates and residual sum of squares (SSR) are reported below. For the first model (model A), estimated stan- dard errors are also reported in parentheses below the coefficient estimates.
